newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria M1 up 4.29 pct, M2 down 3.25 pct in week.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria M1 up 4.29 pct, M2 down 3.25 pct in week.

text.p: Bulgarian M1 money supply rose to 398.9 billion levs on March 7 from 382.5 billion levs a week earlier and M2 fell to 3,094.2 billion levs from 3,198 billion levs, preliminary central bank figures showed.
Total broad money decreased 3.25 percent to 3,332.6 billion levs in the week to March 7.
Lev-denominated broad money rose 4.17 percent to 876.2 billion levs while dollar-denominated broad money fell 5.65 percent to 2,456.4 billion levs.

Hard currency-denominated deposits of companies totalled $760.1 million on March 7, up from $695.8 million a week earlier, while individuals' foreign currency deposits rose by $2.8 million to $464 million, figures showed.
Lev-denominated deposits of individuals edged up to 77.5 billion levs on March 7 from 76.6 billion levs the week before.
The lev rose to 1,825.0 to the dollar on March 7 in the central bank fixing used in the calculations from 2,045.5 on February 28. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
